body_content.explanation: a number of similar events or people that happen, exist, etc. after each other:
examples: A succession of scandals and revelations has undermined the government over the past year.
Life was just an endless succession of parties and dinners.
She had her first three children in rapid succession.

body_content.explanation: a process in which someone automatically takes an official position or job after someone else:
examples: His divorce will not prevent the Prince of Wales's succession to the throne.
Who comes after the vice-president in the presidential line of succession?
